Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Removed some hot path logs" (#7846) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: This was logging *every* time a search service request was sent. This line alone produces 500k-1m log lines per hour and duplicates the `dependencies` logging that is populated automatically.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Fix grammar in verify tool message" (#7781) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Incorrect error message when PDB does not match DLL" (#7844) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

A user wants to update their .snupkg associated with an already pushed package:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/tusdotnet/2.2.2

There is an existing .snupkg that was accepted but subsequent attempts fail with this error:

> The uploaded symbols package contains one or more pdbs that are not portable.

However upon closer investigation, the failure is not because the PDBs are portable but because the PEReader saw that the PDB and DLL do not match.

I think the error is here:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/dbd927c309005b63b82c1017ff6bfcfec96434cf/src/Validation.Symbols/SymbolsValidatorService.cs#L251

This should use the error message `ValidationIssue.SymbolErrorCode_MatchingAssemblyNotFound`.

### To Reproduce

Upload a snupkg with a portable PDB that matches in name but does not match according to `PEReader.TryOpenAssociatedPortablePdb`.

### Expected behavior

The validation should fail with a more helpful error message.

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/74369714-b2465200-4d8a-11ea-8bed-bffec4118b73.png)


### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update docs on how to create a dotnet cli template package with dotnet pack" (#8018) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The following docs page says this: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/custom-templates#packing-a-template-into-a-nuget-package-nupkg-file

> Currently, a custom template is packed on Windows with nuget.exe (not dotnet pack). For cross-platform packaging, consider using NuGetizer 3000.

We should update the docs to explain how to pack with `dotnet pack`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Content files copied to output are not inherited by other projects" (#9176) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Using VS2019 and a solution with lots of csprojs,
I have created a NuGet package which just copies a exe file to /bin.

`<contentFiles>
  <files include="**/helper.exe" buildActions="Content" copyToOutput="true" />
</contentFiles>`

The package works fine, but if I reference the project in an other project, the exe file (contentFiles) is not copied.

Referencing the package in the top project is not an option, because it is still using the old package.json.

How do I get the content files copied to inherited projects?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[CPVM] Re-discuss the CPV merge location" (#9175) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There were question for the location where the CPV and package reference merge needs to be done. 
At the entry point by (msbuild, VS, static restore graph entry points) or before restore .
Currently the merge is before restore when the packagespec is added to the dgspec. 

This item is to track if we need to change to do it at entry points.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Documentation on how to use the *.csproj CDATA block to provide information?" (#9174) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
How do I use the CDATA block as a first class citizent to provide rich text and hyperlinks to information relevant to my customers to use the package? 

Is there reference documentation somewhere?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Better support for C++/CLI (CLR) projects" (#9130) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe Version: 5.4.0.6315
Visual Studio UI 16.3.4

OS version:
Win10 1909 10.0.18363 (18363.592)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Create a C++/CLI or CLR project in Visual Studio.
2. Attempt to install a .NET NuGet package into that project.

### Expected
Package is installed and referenced in a similar way to how C# projects would be handled

### Actual
```
Attempting to gather dependency information for package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3' with respect to project 'MyClrLib', targeting 'native,Version=v0.0'
Gathering dependency information took 153.71 ms
Attempting to resolve dependencies for package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3' with DependencyBehavior 'Lowest'
Resolving dependency information took 0 ms
Resolving actions to install package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3'
Resolved actions to install package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3'
  GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/12.0.3/newtonsoft.json.12.0.3.nupkg
  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/12.0.3/newtonsoft.json.12.0.3.nupkg 5ms
Installing Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.3.
Install failed. Rolling back...
Package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3' does not exist in project 'MyClrLib'
Package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3' does not exist in folder 'd:\src\MyApplication\packages'
Executing nuget actions took 907.78 ms
Could not install package 'Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.3'. You are trying to install this package into a project that targets 'native,Version=v0.0', but the package does not contain any assembly references or content files that are compatible with that framework. For more information, contact the package author.
Time Elapsed: 00:00:01.1156922
========== Finished ==========
```
